name: HorseInventory
description: The `HorseInventory` class provides functionality for interacting with horse inventory screens in Minecraft. This includes managing saddles, armor, and chest inventories for horses, donkeys, mules, and similar equine mobs. It extends the base `Inventory` class and adds horse-specific functionality while inheriting all standard inventory operations.
overview:
This class is automatically created when you open a horse inventory screen and can be accessed through `Player.getInventory()` or `Inventory.create()` when a horse inventory is open.

The `HorseInventory` class handles various horse and donkey-type entities, including:
- **Horses** - Can wear saddles and horse armor
- **Donkeys** - Can wear saddles and have chest inventory
- **Mules** - Can wear saddles and have chest inventory
- **Llamas** - Can have chest inventory (special carpet decoration)
- **Other AbstractHorseEntity subclasses**

constructors.description: Creates a new `HorseInventory` instance for the specified horse inventory screen.

methods.name: canBeSaddled
methods.description: Checks if the horse associated with this inventory can be saddled.

methods.name: isSaddled
methods.description: Checks if the horse associated with this inventory currently has a saddle equipped.

methods.name: getSaddle
methods.description: Gets the item stack in the saddle slot of the horse.

methods.name: hasArmorSlot
methods.description: Checks if the horse associated with this inventory has an armor slot.

methods.name: getArmor
methods.description: Gets the item stack in the armor slot of the horse.

methods.name: hasChest
methods.description: Checks if the horse associated with this inventory has a chest (container) inventory.

methods.name: getInventorySize
methods.description: Gets the number of slots available in the horse's chest inventory.

methods.name: getHorseInventory
methods.description: Gets a list of all item stacks currently in the horse's chest inventory.

methods.name: getHorse
methods.description: Gets the `AbstractHorseEntityHelper` object representing the horse associated with this inventory, providing access to horse-specific information and statistics.
